definition: to rise early and sleep late (idiom); to work hard/to study diligently/to burn the candle at both ends
morning/early/long-held/long-cherished

feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
surname Xing
night
variant of 夜[ye4]
to sleep soundly
to dress before light and not eat before dark (idiom)/diligently attending to official matters
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day

untiring/indefatigable
concerted efforts in a common cause (idiom); united and working together

lit. to spit out one's heart and spill blood (idiom)/to work one's heart out/blood, sweat and tears
to spare no effort
cautious and diligent all day long (idiom)
to bend to a task and spare no effort (idiom); striving to the utmost
to make nothing of hardships
untiring/without slacking
to neglect sleep and forget about food (idiom)/to skip one's sleep and meals/to be completely wrapped up in one's work
